article:
{{Infobox River | river_name = Bar
  | image_name = caption = origin = mouth = Meuse basin_countries = France
  | length = 62 km elevation = discharge = watershed =
}} The 'Bar' is a river in the Ardennes department, northern France, left
tributary of the river Meuse. Its source is near Buzancy, in the southern part
of the Ardennes department. It flows through Brieulles-sur-Bar, Tannay, ChÃ©mery-sur-
Bar and Cheveuges. It flows into the Meuse in Vrigne-Meuse, west of Sedan. For
much of its length the river flows parallel to the Canal des Ardennes.
